pr_title: fixing error message when fails to load content of index.html (#8593)

timeline.message: fixing error message when fails to load content of index.html

timeline.bodyText: I believe you can use @Rule ExpectedException exceptionRule and then expect() and exceptionRule.expectMessage() here. Flow project has many examples of such a usage.
timeline.author: mshabarov

timeline.bodyText: Better use Assert.assertNotNull(), because it's a test, not a production code.
timeline.author: mshabarov

timeline.bodyText: Why are you ignore the exceptions? Try-catch should be excluded and those exceptions should be added to method signature, and if being thrown, fails the test.
timeline.author: mshabarov

timeline.bodyText: Maybe I missed something, but this file deletion looks like a side effect that may have an impact on other tests, because the require this file to be presented. I think we have to re-create this file in the end of test.
timeline.author: mshabarov

replies.bodyText: UPDATE: Yes. The tests are failing because of that. So, please re-create a file or choose another way to simulate the index.html absence.
replies.author: mshabarov

replies.bodyText: Yes indead, So I simulated the absence by renaming the file and finally restore it
